intro: Ototropis kulhaitensis, commonly known as the Kulhait mountain bellflower, is a perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its slender stems and clustered, bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils at high altitudes, showcasing its adaptability to harsh environments. Its leaves are finely divided and aromatic, while its flowers range in color from white to pale purple. Ototropis kulhaitensis is of interest to botanists due to its unique ecological niche and potential medicinal properties.
